concepts.label: Public Safety and Welfare
concepts.description: The paramount obligation of engineers to prioritize the safety, health, and welfare of the public above all other considerations in their professional work.
text_references: Engineers must hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public in the performance of their professional duties. This takes precedence over other considerations.
Always conduct thorough risk assessments
Never compromise safety standards for cost or schedule
Promptly report potential dangers to appropriate authorities

concepts.label: Professional Competence
concepts.description: The obligation for engineers to only perform services in areas where they have adequate expertise, knowledge, and skills.
text_references: Engineers shall perform services only in areas of their competence.
Maintain and improve technical skills through continuous education
Accept assignments only when qualified by education or experience
Engage qualified experts when projects require knowledge beyond personal expertise

concepts.label: Truthfulness in Public Statements
concepts.description: The requirement for engineers to be objective, truthful, and comprehensive in all public communications and professional reports.
text_references: Engineers shall issue public statements only in an objective and truthful manner.
Disclose all pertinent information in professional reports, statements, and testimony
Include all relevant data in public statements
Avoid statements containing material misrepresentation of fact

concepts.label: Faithful Agency
concepts.description: The duty of engineers to act as faithful agents or trustees for their employers and clients, protecting their interests while maintaining ethical standards.
text_references: Engineers shall act as faithful agents or trustees for each employer or client.
Avoid conflicts of interest
Protect confidential information
Make employers or clients aware of consequences if professional judgment is overruled

concepts.label: Professional Integrity
concepts.description: The commitment to avoid deceptive acts in professional practice and to maintain honest representation of qualifications and capabilities.
text_references: Engineers shall avoid deceptive acts in the solicitation of professional employment.
Present qualifications and capabilities honestly
Avoid improper solicitation of professional employment
Base professional reputation on merit of services

concepts.label: Ethical Conduct
concepts.description: The overarching obligation for engineers to conduct themselves honorably, responsibly, ethically, and lawfully in all professional activities.
text_references: Engineers shall conduct themselves honorably, responsibly, ethically, and lawfully.
Maintain high standards of honesty and integrity
Zero tolerance for bribery, fraud, and corruption
Support colleagues who uphold ethical standards

concepts.label: Sustainability
concepts.description: The responsibility of engineers to consider environmental impacts and resource efficiency in their designs and to adhere to principles of sustainable development.
text_references: Engineers should strive to adhere to principles of sustainable development.
Consider environmental impacts in design decisions
Minimize resource consumption and waste generation
Design for longevity, reusability, and recyclability

concepts.label: Intellectual Property Respect
concepts.description: The obligation to respect and properly attribute intellectual property rights, including patents, copyrights, and innovations.
text_references: Engineers shall respect intellectual property rights.
Properly attribute ideas and innovations
Honor patents, copyrights, and other forms of intellectual property
Maintain proper documentation of design decisions

concepts.label: Whistleblowing
concepts.description: The ethical responsibility to report unethical behavior or practices that could endanger public safety, following appropriate reporting procedures.
text_references: Engineers have an ethical responsibility to report unethical behavior or practices that could endanger public safety.
Follow proper reporting procedures within organizations
If internal reporting fails, consider appropriate external reporting
Document concerns and actions taken

concepts.label: Emerging Technology Ethics
concepts.description: The responsibility to consider broader societal implications when working with emerging technologies, including potential misuse and impacts on privacy and security.
text_references: Engineers working with emerging technologies should consider broader societal implications.
Evaluate potential misuse of technology
Consider impacts on privacy, security, and social well-being
Engage with multidisciplinary experts to understand implications

concepts.label: Cultural and Global Awareness
concepts.description: The obligation to respect cultural differences and consider global impacts of engineering work, including environmental and social consequences.
text_references: Engineers should be aware of cultural differences and global impacts of their work.
Respect local cultural practices and values
Consider global environmental and social impacts
Promote fair labor practices throughout supply chains

concepts.label: Public
concepts.description: The general population whose safety, health, and welfare must be prioritized in engineering work.
text_references: Engineers must hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public in the performance of their professional duties.

concepts.label: Employers and Clients
concepts.description: Organizations or individuals who engage engineering services and for whom engineers must act as faithful agents or trustees.
text_references: Engineers shall act as faithful agents or trustees for each employer or client.

concepts.label: Colleagues
concepts.description: Fellow engineering professionals with whom engineers interact and whom they should support in upholding ethical standards.
text_references: Support colleagues who uphold ethical standards

concepts.label: Risk Assessment
concepts.description: The systematic process of evaluating potential risks and hazards associated with engineering projects to ensure public safety.
text_references: Always conduct thorough risk assessments

concepts.label: Continuous Education
concepts.description: The ongoing process of maintaining and improving technical skills and knowledge throughout an engineer's career.
text_references: Maintain and improve technical skills through continuous education

concepts.label: Honesty
concepts.description: The fundamental value of truthfulness and integrity in all professional communications and actions.
text_references: Maintain high standards of honesty and integrity
Present qualifications and capabilities honestly

concepts.label: Responsibility
concepts.description: The value of being accountable for one's professional actions and decisions and their consequences.
text_references: Engineers shall conduct themselves honorably, responsibly, ethically, and lawfully.

concepts.label: Safety Standards
concepts.description: Established guidelines and requirements designed to ensure the safety of engineering projects and products.
text_references: Never compromise safety standards for cost or schedule

concepts.label: Conflict of Interest
concepts.description: Situations where personal interests could compromise professional judgment or obligations to employers, clients, or the public.
text_references: Avoid conflicts of interest
